The ERP, which is included in the county-wide community emergency response plan, provides local emergency responders with information necessary to sufficiently understand the hazards a potential escaping chlorine cloud poses to the community and to properly respond to an accident at the plant.  The ERP includes a prediction of the most likely path a toxic cloud may take based on the local topography.  

Effective emergency action and response is ensured through ongoing training of emergency response procedures.  Plant operators are trained on chlorine hazards, stopping chlorine leaks, and emergency procedures and equipment.  To further improve safety at this facility the plant has installed electronic air monitoring equipment to ensure that, if a leak were to occur, personnel will respond and correct it as quickly as possible.

This Risk Management Program is designed so that each element may be easily implemented and maintained ensuring that potential hazards are closely monitored, operators stay sufficiently trained, and an emergency will be handled as efficiently as possible.  This will assure that the Commerce Water Treatment Plant will continue the safe operation of its chlorination process while providing quality drinking water for the surrounding region.
